info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 3:31AM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following county, Mohave. * WHEN...Until 630 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 329 AM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following drainages... Reference Point Creek, Truxton Wash, Salt Creek, Surprise Canyon, Fox Canyon Wash, Lost Creek, Spencer Canyon, Iron Spring Wash, Grapevine Wash, and Hualapai Wash. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grand Canyon Ranch, Grand Canyon Skywalk and Pierce Ferry And Antares Roads. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
